SENT.plain: Evidence-based information is a prerequisite for informed choice
We compared the effect of evidence-based information on colorectal cancer screening with standard information in a randomised controlled trial
The primary endpoint was informed choice

The evidence-based information significantly increased informed choices: 44.0% vs. 12.8%; (difference 31.2%, 99% CI 25.7-36.7%; P<0.001)
